2132.subject: SW
2132.descrlong: This advanced course introduces content about client populations, social policy, and practice in the area of Child Welfare. This course will emphasize the policies, programs, and services related to child welfare as well as evidence-informed interventions and skills for effective practice. Special topics include child development, parenting practices, legal and ethical responsibilities of mandated reporters, and culturally relevant services. May be offered as classroom based, hybrid, or online.
